Merge branch 'reorganization'
Old master/compile-script replaced with a Makefile

Added version check to jobs.

This should prevent mysterious job failures when the Python version on the client
side doesn't match with Python running on nodes.
Distrfiles now run with nice and ionice
Added setup.py's to python packages
Updated the tests to use the new-style Python modules
Removed an unnecessary import
bugfix: fixed a regression in Job._run()
DISCO_PORT changed back to 8989
unnecessary py/disco_test.py removed
disco/pydisco added to the worker's PYTHONPATH
bugfix: DeprecatedFunc didn't work correctly

Major restructuring of the Python code: Packages pydisco and node added.

Python modules under the old disco/py/ directory were splitted to
submodules and divided to two packages, client and node.
Old README deleted. The same information can be found in doc/.

New configuration mechanism added. Disco-master startup script rewritten.

New lighttpd config files. Removed unnecessary files.

Removed disco_url and disco_slave parameters. Added disco_name.

disco_url is now inferred from the SCGI request.
disco_slave is now inferred from disco_name.

Now binaries for disco_worker.erl are searched in disco/master/ebin and DISCO_HOME/ebin (in this order).

Python worker is launched in disco/py/ or in PATH (in this order).

Separated address resolving code to disco.disco_host().

Changed discoapi to use the new function.
Made disco_worker.py executable

disco.py doesn't depend on disco_worker.py anymore.

Now disco_worker.py depends on disco.py. Added load_conf() that
reads DISCO_PORT and DISCO_ROOT from a config file or from env.variables
if available.

Protocol disco://host:port marked as deprecated.

bugfix: Distrfiles.py didn't handle long paths correctly. Thanks to
Lexiang for reporting the bug.

Removed job status check from discoadmin. Now also running jobs can be
cleaned (which will automatically kill them).
Updated documentation for the combiner and partitioning functions
RATE_LIMIT raised from 5 to 10 messages per second

BACKWARDS INCOMPATIBLE CHANGES:
	- combiner / partition interfaces changed: they now get the
	  parameters object as the last argument
	- combiner interface changed: combiner can now return an
	  iterator of key-value pairs whenever it wants. Flag done (old
	  flush) is raised when all input has been consumed, so combiner
	  can return its final iterator.
Fixed a bug in tutorial code. Thanks Vineet.
Fixed two bugs in tutorial examples. Thanks to Arjun!
added support for netstring encoding to the netstring module
added kill -option to discoadmin

fixed a fatal bug in disco.c -- in some cases read_parameters() would
read too many bytes, which broke everything
discoadmin added
fixed a small typo in disco_worker.rst
fixed a bug in disco.Params: Params._state wasn't instantiated correctly during unpickling
fixed minor typos in the docs
added documentation about homedisco
HomeDisco.job() returns now a list of results, like disco.job()

A local tester / debugger / profiler, homedisco, implemented that can run Disco
jobs locally, without a master

discoapi.joblist() added, discoapi.parameters() renamed to

tutorial added
improving documentation..
Starting to create Disco documentation with Sphinx. First files.

a major improvement: event_server saves events to a file and does not
keep everything in memory at once. A major overhaul for event handling,
which results to faster operation with a smaller memory footprint.

added NATIVE flag for the compile script to choose between hipe and
non-hipe compilation
fixed a bug in msg rate limit

added 16GB ulimit for disco master to prevent disasterous memory leaks
from trashing the server

rate limit for msg() calls implemented. Now a worker is killed if it sends
more than five messages per second.

Maximum message length set to 255 characters.
added a way retrieve parameters from the master
disco.Params() can now include functions that are marshalled properly by Disco
parameters are now serialized with cPickle, not marshal. Fixed a bug in netstring reader.
improvements and bug fixes to the external interface

major imporvement (which largely reverts the previous commit): Parameter sets are now
distributed outside the disco master by a web server. This makes master's memory footprint
much smaller, which makes it much more scalable, as parameters are not stored in the
master's memory space.
parameter set is now copied in chunks rather than in one huge blob.
Intro text added
fixed a bug in test_external.py
External jobs seem to work. A new test, test_external.py, passes.
disco external interface: Initial commit with bindings for C

major improvement: Instead of using ssh to launch worker processes on nodes, we use a
slave Erlang VM on each node to supervise the workers. In addition, parameters for tasks
are not copied to nodes on per-task basis, but copied there once and cached to disk
through the param_cache server.
removed unused stop() from job_queue
added PREFIX and DISCO_PORT parameters to start_disco
increased maximum packet size from 10MB to 1GB in netstring.py

All inputs converted to binary: SCGI and Netsting parsing works now on binaries
instead of lists. Also worked around the 16MB message limit, caused by
gen_tcp:recv().

Added chunked-parameter to disco.job(). Now map results are merged to chunked
input only if reduce is specified. Otherwise chaining multiple map operations
could be difficult, in case that nr_reduces > 1.

This behavior can be changed using the new chunked parameter.
bugfix: Results from map (no reduce) were not returned correctly
disco.job() handles dir:// inputs automatically
bug fix: results are now returned correctly
added a script to run and evalute tests, minor changes in test scripts
fixed a minor misfeature in test_50k
bug fix: Fixed a bug in pgrep / pkill pattern that caused wrong processes to be killed occasionally
async test and discoapi enhancements
test_chain added, minor clean ups in disco.py and test_sort.py
added clean=True to test_sort
Discoapi added - a thin Python wrapper for the Disco web api
minor enhancements for the 50k test
external sort works again
HTTP connection pooling added to support larger jobs
event_server separated from disco_server
minor changes in test_50k test

major features added:
 - chunk:// protocol for saving and reading all intermediate results in one file
 - dir:// protocol for retrieving the list of intermediate results directly from a httpd server

--> a major imporovement for the master's memory footprint ad scalability in general
now all processes started by disco are nice -n 19

add_job_event and kill_worker calls are made asynchronous. This should make it possible to handle a much larger number of
workers concurrently.

bug fix: name is returned correctly in async=True mode
added a pause to disco_worker.py
bug fix: Show only 100 inputs if there are more than that. Otherwise browser complains about Javascript being too busy.

bug fix: Spurious "Watchdog lost xxx" messages were caused by watchdog seeing a succesful task disappear before it was
reported to the master. As the result, master saw a DAT line before the END line, causing a data error.

The fix was to make the process pause for 10 seconds before exiting, after the END line is sent.
First test scripts
removed a forgotted debug aid
a new job_queue server implemented. Now it should be possible to handle much larger tasks with a smaller memory footprint.

Check for ionice before using it.

Update to Makefile.

Set usable permissions so that a non-root user can access needed files.

If config files in /etc/disco already exist, don't overwrite them; simply print
a message that installing the file has been skipped..

Adding PREFIX and SYSCONFDIR to Makefile.

Using PREFIX and SYSCONFDIR instead of DESTDIR allows to install in an
alternate location.

Install python packages with --prefix.

Using --prefix will properly add the python packages to $DESTDIR
rather than $DESTDIR/usr.
